channel.title: Please help! - very important!
channel.description:
Okay So I have my source and client set up and everything I've port forwarded changed the server/client's IP got no-ip Etc, etc.. Ive had many people try to help me but none the less they all fail. Basically I cant host my server.. So If i buy a VPS can I get my server online?
Someone link me to a vps please? Willing to go about $10 a month Wanting to use Project Amaze Source Thanks

item.title: Please help! - very important!
item.dc:creator: @judostar1 judostar1
item.description:
@judostar1 wrote:

vps’ are annoying sometimes when ur trying to turn it back on.

Read full topic

I’ve bought a 2G windows VPS from vpsland recently, they seem really good to be honest! Most servers I know use it because there rather professional hosting.
[/quote]VPSland has cheap window vps prices, however, their customer service is horrible. I would suggest anybody but them.[/quote]

i ordered one from wooservers

item.title: Please help! - very important!
item.dc:creator: @eballer48 eballer48
item.description:
@eballer48 wrote:

[quote=“escalation, post:24, topic:407913”]Because they are a lot harder to set up. Windows is the way to go.

Plus you need to spend money to make money. A good vps for starting off would be http://www.vpsland.com
however, when you start getting more and more players I suggest switching to another vps, because vpsland is not all that reliable.[/quote]

vps land is sooo expensive though is there a cheaper alternative?

Read full topic

item.title: Please help! - very important!
item.dc:creator: @judostar1 judostar1
item.description:
@judostar1 wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:15, topic:407913”][quote author=judostar1 link=topic=509199.msg3694625#msg3694625 date=1312345139]

I’ve tried to help him with this problem many times, on both his regular pc and his laptop, there’s just something wrong with his ip. I suggest you go with the vps man.

It’s nothing to do with the ip, it could be his router, or his firewall that does not want to unblock port 43594.

I’ve unblocked his pot 43594, I turned off his firewall, tried all that shit. And it’s not necessarily his router, I’ve had the same as him, and my server worked fine. It could very well be that the portfoward wasn’t one correctly. Anyways I can’t help, gotta do a lot of shit
[/quote]
Ye same my dad had to help me since he is a good programmer, and he had to unblock the port 43594 over and over. He could try to block all the ports, and unblock his firewall, then try to run the server and see if it’s open.[/quote]

Dlink routers are a pain >.>

Read full topic

item.title: Please help! - very important!
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“judostar1, post:14, topic:407913”][quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=509199.msg3694599#msg3694599 date=1312343949]

I’ve tried to help him with this problem many times, on both his regular pc and his laptop, there’s just something wrong with his ip. I suggest you go with the vps man.

It’s nothing to do with the ip, it could be his router, or his firewall that does not want to unblock port 43594.
[/quote]

I’ve unblocked his pot 43594, I turned off his firewall, tried all that shit. And it’s not necessarily his router, I’ve had the same as him, and my server worked fine. It could very well be that the portfoward wasn’t one correctly. Anyways I can’t help, gotta do a lot of shit :P[/quote]
Ye same my dad had to help me since he is a good programmer, and he had to unblock the port 43594 over and over. He could try to block all the ports, and unblock his firewall, then try to run the server and see if it’s open.

Read full topic

item.title: Please help! - very important!
item.dc:creator: @tb1 tb
item.description:
@tb1 wrote:

Though he can host for free the quality of his computer could be bad, he may not be able to portforward at all, and other reasons lol. Might as well get the VPS and save time, since sometimes it may take a while to setup.

Read full topic

item.title: Please help! - very important!
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

mrdrzj:

that is good idea but if he dont want to waste money, he can just easily fix his problem (with help(me) ) and run it normally vps is a waste of money when u start a server, it is good when u have many people on a server and get donations.

VPS is much better then hosting it yourself idiot. The VPS can host 24/7, and auto-portforwards for you, their not even that expensive.
